response.name: NotABrowser

header.name: Accept-Ranges
header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable

header.name: Age
header.description: The age the object has been in a proxy cache in seconds

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Last-Modified
header.description: The last modified date for the requested object, in RFC 2822 format

header.name: Set-Cookie
header.description: an HTTP cookie

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: Via
header.description: Informs the client of proxies through which the response was sent.

header.name: X-Cache
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Cache-Hits
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-DNS-Prefetch-Control
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Request-Guid
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Served-By
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Timer
header.description: Custom header

my Sql data table

Ask Question
up vote -1 down vote favorite

Help for sql C# data table Having problem with DATA source. need to pull System.Data.SQLite.dll from a created folder connected to the c# program Write a C# windows form program with a DataTable and DataGrid.

For the DataTable, add a DataTable by program control. Have six columns and add data for five rows.

Add your own data to the DataTable.

The columns should be:

ID, LastName, FirstName, Age, GPA, Birthday.

Read all the data from the DataTable and display to a RichTextBox under program control.

Drag a DataGrid to the form during design time. Read all the data from the DataTable and write to the DataGrid under program contrPut your picture and class information in the lower right hand side of the form. Rename the default form1 class to the name of your program and add to the form text title bar the name of your program.

Form with 1 button and a rich text box.

Format should be as such

  {
  private void button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
  SQLiteConnection.CreateFile("..\\..\\MyDatabase.sqlite");
  string dbConnectionString = "Data Source = ..\\..\\MyDatabase.sqlite, 
  Version = 3; foreign key = true; ";
  MessageBox.Show(dbConnectionString);
  SQLiteConnection dbConnection = new SQLiteConnection(dbConnectionString);
 dbConnection.Open();

string sql = "CREATE TABLE Student(ID INTETGER PRIMARY KEY, Name TEXT NOT 
NULL, Score INTEGER NOT NULL, GPA REAL NOT NULL)";
 MessageBox.Show(sql);
 SQLiteCommand command = new SQLiteCommand(sql, dbConnection);
 command.ExecuteNonQuery();

 sql = "INSERT INTO Student(ID, Name, Score, GPA) VALUES(NULL, 'Chad' , 
 3000, 3.72)";
 command = new SQLiteCommand(sql, dbConnection);
 command.ExecuteNonQuery();}}
